abstract: After years of frittering away Cisco’s cash on acquisitions and overpriced stock buybacks, John Chambers has gotten religion.
snippet: After years of frittering away Cisco’s cash on acquisitions and overpriced stock buybacks, John Chambers has gotten religion.
lead_paragraph: John Chambers and Steve Ballmer have much in common. For more than a decade, both have run dominant, rapidly maturing tech juggernauts — Mr. Chambers at Cisco Systems and Mr. Ballmer at Microsoft. And both have let down their shareholders. The difference is that one seems to have recognized the error of his ways and is repenting.

headline.main: Head of Cisco Mends His Ways
headline.print_headline: Head of Cisco Mends His Ways

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Ian Campbell
